core.manager module¶

Collection of manager classes.

class core.manager.ConfigManager(path: str, schema_manager)¶

Bases: object

ConfigManager loads and stores the OpenADMS Node configuration.

config¶
get(key: str) → typing.Dict[str, typing.Any]¶

Returns a single configuration.

Parameters:key – The name of the configuration.
Returns:A dictionary with the configuration.
get_valid_config(schema_name: str, *args) → typing.Dict[str, typing.Any]¶

Returns the validated configuration of a module. Raises a ValueError exception if the configuration is invalid.

Parameters:
  • schema_name – Name of the JSON schemes.
  • *args – Key names to the module’s configuration.
Returns:

A dictionary with the module’s configuration.
Raises:

ValueError – If module configuration is invalid.
load_config_from_file(config_path: str) → bool¶

Loads configuration from a JSON file.

Parameters:config_path – The path to the JSON file.
Returns:True if file has been loaded, False if not.
path¶

class core.manager.ModuleManager(manager: core.manager.Manager)¶

Bases: object

ModuleManager loads and manages OpenADMS Node modules.

add(module_name: str, class_path: str)¶

Instantiates a worker, instantiates a messenger, and bundles both to a module. The module will be added to the modules dictionary.

Parameters:
  • module_name – Name of the module.
  • class_path – Path to the Python class.
Returns:

True if module has been added, False if not.
Raises:

ValueError – If module file not exists.
delete(name: str) → None¶

Removes a module from the modules dictionary.

Parameters:name – The name of the module.
get(name: str) → core.module.Module¶

Returns a specific module.

Parameters:name – The name of the module.
get_modules_list() → typing.KeysView¶

Returns a list with all names of all modules.

Returns:List of modules names.
get_uptime_string() → str¶

Returns the software uptime as a formatted string (days, hours, minutes, seconds).

Returns:String with the software uptime.
get_worker(module_name: str, class_path: str) → modules.prototype.Prototype¶

Loads a Python class from a given path and returns the instance.

Parameters:
  • module_name – Name of the module.
  • class_path – Path to the Python class.
Returns:

Instance of Python class or None.
has_module(name: str) → bool¶

Returns whether or not module is found.

Parameters:name – The name of the module.
Returns:True if module is found, False if not.
module_exists(class_path: str) → bool¶

Returns whether or not a OpenADMS Node module exists at the given class path.

Parameters:class_path – The path to the class.
Returns:True if module exists, False if not.
modules¶
start(module_name: str) → None¶

Starts a module.

Parameters:module_name – The name of the module.
start_all() → None¶

Starts all modules.

stop(module_name: str) → None¶

Stops a module.

Parameters:module_name – The name of the module.

class core.manager.SchemaManager(schema_root_path: str = 'schemes')¶

Bases: object

SchemaManager stores JSON schemes and validates given data with them.

add_schema(data_type: str, path: str) → bool¶

Reads a JSON schemes file from the given path and stores it in the internal dictionary.

Parameters:
  • data_type – The name of the data type (e.g., ‘observation’).
  • path – The path to the JSON schemes file.
Returns:

True if schemes has been added, False if not.
get_schema_path(class_path: str) → pathlib.Path¶

Uses the class path of a module to generate the path to the configuration schemes file.

For instance, the given class path modules.schedule.Scheduler will be converted to the file path modules/schedule/scheduler.json.

Parameters:class_path – The class path of a module.
Returns:The path to the JSON schemes of the module’s configuration.
has_schema(name: str) → bool¶

Returns whether or not a JSON schemes for the given name exists.

Parameters:name – Name of the schemes (e.g., ‘observation’).
Returns:True if schemes exists, False if not.
is_valid(data: typing.Dict, schema_name: str) → bool¶

Validates data with JSON schemes and returns result.

Parameters:
  • data – The data.
  • schema_name – The name of the schemes used for validation.
Returns:

True if data is valid, False if not.
class core.manager.SensorManager(config_manager: core.manager.ConfigManager)¶

Bases: object

SensorManager stores and manages object of type Sensor.

add_sensor(name: str, sensor: core.sensor.Sensor) → None¶

Adds a sensor to the sensors dictionary.

Parameters:
  • name – The name of the sensor.
  • sensor – The sensor object.
delete(name: str) → None¶

Removes a sensor from the sensors dictionary.

get(name: str) → core.sensor.Sensor¶

Returns the sensor object with the given name.

get_sensors_names() → typing.KeysView¶

Returns a list with all sensor names.

load_sensors() → None¶

Creates the sensors defined in the configuration.

sensors¶
